name: Yellowstone
funFact: Yellowstone’s Grand Prismatic Spring is the largest hot spring in the U.S., with stunning colors visible from space!
description: Known for its geothermal features and wildlife.

name: Yosemite
funFact: Yosemite Falls is the highest waterfall in North America, plunging a total of 2,425 feet.
description: Features breathtaking waterfalls and giant sequoias.

name: Grand Canyon
funFact: The Grand Canyon is over 277 miles long and reaches depths of over a mile.
description: Famous for its vast and colorful rock formations.

name: Zion
funFact: Zion’s Angel’s Landing hike features a chain-assisted climb and offers one of the most thrilling views in the park.
description: Known for its towering canyons and unique rock formations.

name: Arches
funFact: Delicate Arch is a symbol of Utah and has appeared on the state’s license plates since 1999.
description: Home to over 2,000 natural stone arches.

name: Glacier
funFact: The park is named for its 26 glaciers, though many have significantly shrunk in recent years.
description: Famous for its glacial landscapes and diverse wildlife.

name: Great Smoky Mountains
funFact: The park’s name comes from the ‘smoky’ mist that often envelops the mountains due to the high humidity.
description: Features lush, green forests and rich biodiversity.

name: Olympic
funFact: Olympic National Park contains the Hoh Rain Forest, one of the rainiest places in the U.S.
description: Offers a mix of rainforests, alpine peaks, and coastal areas.

name: Acadia
funFact: Acadia’s Cadillac Mountain is the first place to see sunrise in the U.S. from October to March.
description: Known for its scenic coastal views and granite peaks.

name: Denali
funFact: Denali’s peak, formerly known as Mount McKinley, stands at 20,310 feet, making it the highest peak in North America.
description: Features vast wilderness and breathtaking mountain vistas.

name: Sequoia
funFact: General Sherman Tree is over 2,200 years old and weighs approximately 2.7 million pounds.
description: Known for its massive sequoia trees and mountainous terrain.

name: Kings Canyon
funFact: Kings Canyon’s deepest point is over 8,000 feet deep, creating dramatic views.
description: Features deep canyons and rugged landscapes.

name: Cuyahoga Valley
funFact: The park has over 125 miles of hiking trails and is home to the scenic Cuyahoga River.
description: Offers beautiful landscapes with waterfalls and historic sites.

name: Everglades
funFact: Everglades National Park is the only place in the world where alligators and crocodiles coexist.
description: Known for its unique wetland ecosystem and diverse wildlife.

name: Haleakalā
funFact: Haleakalā’s crater is so large that it can fit the island of Manhattan with room to spare.
description: Features stunning sunrise views and diverse landscapes.

name: Hawaii Volcanoes
funFact: Kīlauea is one of the world’s most active volcanoes, with frequent eruptions over the past decades.
description: Known for its volcanic activity and lava flows.

name: Rocky Mountain
funFact: The park’s Trail Ridge Road is one of the highest paved roads in North America, reaching over 12,000 feet.
description: Features high-altitude mountain landscapes and diverse wildlife.

name: Mount Rainier
funFact: Mount Rainier is covered by 25 major glaciers, more than any other peak in the contiguous U.S.
description: Known for its massive glaciers and wildflower meadows.

name: Great Basin
funFact: Great Basin National Park features the Lehman Caves, a stunning underground cave system with unique formations.
description: Features diverse landscapes including caves and ancient bristlecone pines.

name: Bryce Canyon
funFact: Bryce Canyon is not actually a canyon but a series of natural amphitheaters carved into the edge of a plateau.
description: Famous for its unique hoodoo rock formations.

name: Badlands
funFact: The park’s eroded rock formations resemble a ‘badlands’ terrain, hence the name.
description: Features dramatic landscapes and rich fossil deposits.

name: Lassen Volcanic
funFact: Lassen Volcanic National Park features all four types of volcanoes: shield, composite, cinder cone, and lava dome.
description: Known for its volcanic features and geothermal activity.

name: Mount Hood
funFact: Mount Hood is a dormant stratovolcano that last erupted around 200 years ago, making it one of the most active in the Cascade Range.
description: Offers skiing, climbing, and scenic mountain views.

name: Death Valley
funFact: Death Valley holds the record for the highest air temperature ever recorded on Earth: 134°F (56.7°C).
description: Features extreme temperatures and unique desert landscapes.

name: Channel Islands
funFact: The park’s islands are home to species found nowhere else on Earth, like the Channel Islands fox.
description: Offers stunning coastal views and unique island ecosystems.

name: Pinnacles
funFact: Pinnacles National Park is known for its unique rock formations and is a great place for rock climbing.
description: Features striking geological formations and diverse habitats.

name: Mesa Verde
funFact: Mesa Verde is home to Cliff Palace, one of the largest cliff dwellings in North America.
description: Famous for its well-preserved Ancestral Puebloan cliff dwellings.

name: Capitol Reef
funFact: Capitol Reef is named for the white sandstone dome that resembles the U.S. Capitol building.
description: Known for its colorful rock formations and scenic canyons.

name: Gates of the Arctic
funFact: Gates of the Arctic is the northernmost national park in the U.S., and it has no roads or trails.
description: Offers true wilderness experience with stunning arctic landscapes.

name: Wrangell-St. Elias
funFact: Wrangell-St. Elias is the largest national park in the U.S., covering over 13 million acres.
description: Features diverse terrain including glaciers, mountains, and volcanic landscapes.

name: Katmai
funFact: Katmai is famous for its Brown bears and the Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes, a volcanic landscape.
description: Known for its bear viewing and volcanic activity.

name: Denali
funFact: Denali National Park is home to North America’s highest peak, which was once called Mount McKinley.
description: Features breathtaking mountain views and diverse wildlife.

name: Alaska Range
funFact: The Alaska Range features some of the highest peaks in North America, including Denali.
description: Offers dramatic mountain scenery and challenging climbs.

name: Yosemite
funFact: Yosemite Valley was shaped by glaciers during the last Ice Age, creating its iconic features.
description: Famous for its glacially-carved valleys and granite cliffs.

name: Grand Teton
funFact: Grand Teton National Park is known for its stunning mountain scenery and pristine lakes.
description: Features the majestic Teton Range and beautiful alpine lakes.

name: North Cascades
funFact: North Cascades is often called the ‘American Alps’ due to its rugged terrain and numerous glaciers.
description: Known for its rugged mountains and numerous glaciers.

name: Badlands
funFact: The park’s colorful rock formations and fossil beds date back millions of years.
description: Features dramatic landscapes and rich fossil deposits.

name: Mount Rainier
funFact: Mount Rainier is an active stratovolcano with its last eruption occurring over 100 years ago.
description: Known for its glaciers and towering peak.

name: Great Smoky Mountains
funFact: The park is home to more than 1,500 species of flowering plants, more than any other U.S. national park.
description: Features rich biodiversity and lush forest landscapes.

name: Lassen Volcanic
funFact: Lassen Volcanic National Park is one of the few places in the world where you can see all four types of volcanoes.
description: Known for its diverse volcanic features and geothermal activity.

name: Hawaii Volcanoes
funFact: Kīlauea has been erupting almost continuously from 1983 to 2018, creating new land and reshaping the landscape.
description: Features active volcanoes and lava flows.

name: Glacier
funFact: Glacier National Park’s climate is influenced by its location in the Northern Rocky Mountains, leading to diverse ecosystems.
description: Known for its stunning glaciers and diverse wildlife.

name: Cuyahoga Valley
funFact: The park’s Cuyahoga River was a key site during the Industrial Revolution, shaping the region's history.
description: Features beautiful landscapes and historical sites.

name: Arches
funFact: The park’s iconic arches are formed by the erosion of sandstone over millions of years.
description: Home to thousands of natural stone arches.

name: Channel Islands
funFact: The Channel Islands were once connected to the mainland but became separated by rising sea levels.
description: Features unique island ecosystems and coastal views.

name: Yosemite
funFact: Yosemite National Park contains one of the largest contiguous wilderness areas in the Sierra Nevada.
description: Known for its wilderness and iconic landmarks.

name: Pinnacles
funFact: Pinnacles is home to a unique rock formation known as the Bear Gulch Caves, formed by volcanic activity.
description: Features striking rock formations and diverse habitats.

name: Badlands
funFact: The park’s name comes from the Lakota Sioux language, meaning ‘bad lands’ due to its harsh terrain.
description: Known for its rugged landscapes and rich fossil deposits.

name: Grand Teton
funFact: The Grand Teton peaks are part of the Teton Range, which rises abruptly from the surrounding plains.
description: Features dramatic mountain scenery and alpine lakes.

name: Capitol Reef
funFact: Capitol Reef’s unique rock formations include the Waterpocket Fold, a 100-mile-long ridge.
description: Known for its unique geological features and scenic canyons.

name: Mesa Verde
funFact: Mesa Verde’s Cliff Palace is one of the best-preserved examples of Ancestral Puebloan architecture.
description: Features well-preserved cliff dwellings and archaeological sites.

name: Great Smoky Mountains
funFact: The park is known for its early morning mist, which often gives the Smokies their name.
description: Features lush forests and rich biodiversity.

name: Hawaii Volcanoes
funFact: The park encompasses the summit and rift zones of Kīlauea and Mauna Loa, two of the world’s most active volcanoes.
description: Known for its volcanic activity and dynamic landscapes.

name: Channel Islands
funFact: Channel Islands National Park is a protected area that includes five islands and their surrounding marine environments.
description: Features diverse marine and island ecosystems.

name: Glacier
funFact: The park is renowned for its spectacular glacier-carved valleys and abundant wildlife.
description: Features dramatic glaciers and diverse habitats.

name: Lassen Volcanic
funFact: Lassen Volcanic National Park is home to Lassen Peak, one of the largest volcanic domes in the world.
description: Known for its volcanic features and geothermal activity.

name: North Cascades
funFact: North Cascades National Park is home to over 300 glaciers, more than any other U.S. national park.
description: Features rugged mountains and numerous glaciers.

name: Denali
funFact: Denali’s summit stands at 20,310 feet, making it the highest peak in North America.
description: Features dramatic landscapes and diverse wildlife.

name: Katmai
funFact: The Valley of Ten Thousand Smokes is a result of the 1912 eruption of Novarupta, one of the largest eruptions of the 20th century.
description: Known for its volcanic landscape and bear viewing.

name: Wrangell-St. Elias
funFact: Wrangell-St. Elias includes the highest peak in the U.S., Mount St. Elias, at 18,008 feet.
description: Features a vast wilderness with diverse terrain.

name: Gates of the Arctic
funFact: Gates of the Arctic is one of the least visited national parks, offering a pristine wilderness experience.
description: Known for its remote location and stunning arctic landscapes.

name: Arches
funFact: Arches National Park contains over 2,000 natural stone arches, making it a geological wonder.
description: Home to an impressive collection of natural arches and rock formations.

name: Cuyahoga Valley
funFact: Cuyahoga Valley is known for its scenic railway, offering a picturesque way to explore the park’s natural beauty.
description: Features a mix of natural beauty and historical significance.
